alert.note: Alert for Northwestern San Juan Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 2:47PM MST until January 13 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches with locally higher amounts above 10000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches with locally higher amounts possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Northwest San Juan Mountains. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM MST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Saturday evening through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
